summary: This document is a compilation of daily lieutenant's logs from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, NY, for August 7, 2019. It details routine operational activities, inmate counts, movements, and administrative actions across three shifts (Morning, Day, and Evening Watch). The logs are significant as they provide a detailed snapshot of the facility's operations on a day when Jeffrey Epstein was incarcerated there, though he is not explicitly mentioned in these entries.

events.title: MCC Daily Operations Log
events.description: Routine daily operations at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, including inmate counts, movements, admissions, releases, and system checks across three shifts.

events.title: Inmates Placed in SHU Pending Investigation
events.description: Inmates Rene and Desilva were placed in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) pending an SIS (Special Investigative Services) investigation.

events.title: Inmate Placed in SHU for CIMS Concern
events.description: Inmate Rodriguez was placed in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) due to a 'Cims concern' (likely a Custody and Incident Management System alert).

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
USP Canaan (referenced as origin of an inmate transfer bus)
keyFacts: The document is a detailed operational log from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York for August 7, 2019, covering three 8-hour shifts.
Several inmates were placed in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) for reasons including pending SIS investigations and 'Cims concern'.
The logs indicate routine facility issues, such as a malfunctioning public address system preventing PREA announcements and an inoperative fire alarm pump.
Multiple inmate movements are recorded, including new commitments, releases on bail/bond, transfers to/from general population, and administrative holds.
The document provides context for the operational environment of the MCC but does not contain any direct references to Jeffrey Epstein or his case.
